snippet: Housing prices continue to fall nationwide, with Atlanta earning the distinction as the weakest performer.
abstract: Housing prices continue to fall nationwide, with Atlanta, Ga, earning the unfortunate distinction as the weakest performer; data released by the Standard & Poor's/Case-Shiller Home Price Index show that in November, prices of single-family homes in the area were down close to 12 percent compared with a year earlier; Atlanta is one of only four metro areas to see their home prices slide below 2000 levels, as a glut of foreclosed homes is helping to stall a recovery.

byline.contributor: Seth Feaster contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Housing prices continue to fall nationwide, with Atlanta earning the distinction as the weakest performer.

headline.seo: In Atlanta, Housing Woes Reflect Nation’s Economic Pain
headline.main: In Atlanta, Housing Woes Reflect Nation’s Pain

keywords.value: Standard & Poor's Case-Shiller Home Price Index
keywords.name: subject
